image.altText: A woman holds her face as she stands in a crowd of people

props.synopsis: Israel's military says Hamas has returned the bodies of four hostages from Gaza, with the remains of 24 others yet to be returned. Follow live.

title.children: Israel puts 'pressure' on Hamas over return of hostage bodies

image.altText: Child's hand on play equipment

props.synopsis: The chief executive and chief operating officer at one of Australia's biggest childcare chains have resigned following a string of scandals, including dozens of sex abuse charges being laid against a former employee.

title.children: Breaking: Top executives at Affinity Education Group resign after childcare scandals

image.altText: Paul Keating

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers confirms he spoke with former prime minister Paul Keating last week ahead of the government's U-turn on superannuation. Follow live.

title.children: Chalmers, Keating spoke 'half a dozen times' ahead of super U-turn

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Chalmers spoke with former PM Paul Keating several times last week
Anika Wells says gambling lobby should be transparent about links with parliamentarians
Anika Wells announces 'For the good of' campaign promoting social media ban

image.altText: Anthony Albanese uses his phone on the floor of the House of Represenatives.

props.synopsis: Sussan Ley and other prominent Australians are among those whose details have been made available on a US-based website.

title.children: Anthony Albanese's mobile phone number released online

image.altText: Large ship seen from above.

props.synopsis: Antarctic icebreaker RSV Nuyina has headed to deeper waters off remote Heard Island in the Southern Ocean while assessments are undertaken to see if the hull has suffered any damage after scraping the ocean floor.

title.children: Australia's Antarctic icebreaker scrapes ocean floor near Heard Island

image.altText: A sun burning bright in an orange sky above clouds on the horizon.

props.synopsis: Parts of Pilbara and Kimberley surpassed 40 degrees Celsius yesterday but meteorologists say the temperatures will not trigger a heatwave warning yet.

title.children: Hottest place on Earth located in Australia as 'heat engine' cranks into gear

image.altText: Smiling dark-haired Brittany in a dark blazer walks down a street, 7 news mic thrust in front, Sharaz walks beside.

props.synopsis: Former senator Linda Reynolds files a creditor's petition in the Federal Court against her ex-staffer, Brittany Higgins, as she tries to recover damages awarded to her for defamation.

title.children: Higgins faces bankruptcy proceedings as Reynolds takes new legal action

image.altText: Dave Hughes in a video posted to social media platform, Instagram, lying in a hospital bed

props.synopsis: Comedian Dave Hughes has returned to hospital, six weeks after suffering five broken ribs and a punctured lung in the AFL's Legends game.

title.children: Dave Hughes in hospital again six weeks after AFL Legends game

image.altText: Glove production line at a Top Glove factory

props.synopsis: RBA Board minutes suggest one or no more rate cuts are likely, according to economists, as the ASX trades flat. Follow the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: RBA minutes suggest one or no more rate cuts likely

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Upward trend in "capacity utilisation" makes more rate cuts less likely
Stickiness in inflation opens "can of worms" for RBA
ANZ-Roy Morgan consumer confidence hits 12-month low

image.altText: Julie Inman Grant looking down the barrel of the camera in a portrait.

props.synopsis: Australia's eSafety commissioner says her team has "taken Roblox to task" over its risk of exposing children to harm but warned the online gaming platform may not be included in the upcoming social media ban.

title.children: Roblox 'taken to task' but may not be included in social media ban

image.altText: A person holding a mobile phone surrounded by icons from social media platforms

props.synopsis: From December, children under 16 will be blocked from accessing social media. Follow live as we explore how will it work and what the pitfalls will be.

title.children: The way we use social media is about to change. Join the conversation

image.altText: An older man in a suit stands behind a lecturn with another man standing beside him, in front of Noosa council sign.

props.synopsis: The mayor of a small council that lost nearly $2 million in a "sophisticated" scam says international fraudsters were able to "imitate personalities" using AI.

title.children: AI used to imitate personalities defrauds Noosa council of $2.3m

image.altText: People walk through an covered in mud and debris from a flood

props.synopsis: The death toll from flooding in Mexico's central region has risen to 64, with another 65 people missing, according to the Mexican government.

title.children: Almost 130 people dead or missing in  Mexico floods

image.altText: A man with hiking gear and sunglasses crouches in front of a cliff overlooking a river.

props.synopsis: A search is underway for a Tasmanian man in Mount Field National Park in challenging, snowy conditions after his last contact on Sunday morning said he would seek shelter.

title.children: Search for hiker continues amid 'waist-high' snow in Tasmanian wilderness

image.altText: A man in a black suit leaves court talking on his mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Alexander Thomas Hallett pleaded guilty to winding back a total of 648,000 kilometres on the odometers of seven vehicles.

title.children: Used car salesman fined $25,000 for winding back car odometers

image.altText: Zach Merrett looks to his left after the Bombers lost to the Swans.

props.synopsis: Hawthorn faces a race against time as it looks to acquire Essendon captain Zach Merrett as the AFL trade period ticks towards Wednesday night's deadline. Follow live.

title.children: Essendon rejects Hawthorn's opening offer for Merrett as Sydney tables Curnow bid

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Essendon not willing to budge despite Hawthorn's offer
Hawthorn's first offer for Zach Merrett has arrived
Bailey Humphrey's manager says he is unlikely to be dealt this year

image.altText: A bald man, Paul Kelly, in a dark blue shirt smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: As the 70-year-old songwriter prepares his 30th album, he talks about the music that has driven him creatively.

title.children: Why Paul Kelly likes songs you can 'see and smell'

image.altText: Nick Dametto speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Katter's Australian Party MP Nick Dametto has formally resigned from state parliament to run for Townsville mayor — forcing a by-election in his north Queensland seat.

title.children: Katter MP thanks himself 'for turning up' as he resigns from state parliament

image.altText: Police enter under police tape into a street.

props.synopsis: A 78-year-old woman escapes a blaze on the NSW Mid North Coast, but the body of another woman — believed to be her daughter who lived with disability — is later found inside.

title.children: Mother escapes as house fire claims the life of her daughter

image.altText: Two police officers stand behind police tape that blocks a CBD street.

props.synopsis: A man is being assessed in hospital after a string of alleged carjackings beginning in Melbourne's west ended with his dramatic arrest in the CBD.

title.children: Man arrested after alleged carjackings, dramatic pursuit in Melbourne CBD

image.altText: SES volunteers and ADF personnel and a bus in sparse bushland

props.synopsis: As SA Police and the Australian Defence Force resume their search for missing four-year-old Gus in South Australia's arid mid-north, authorities have announced a new taskforce.

title.children: Search expands for missing boy Gus, as police announce new taskforce

image.altText: Jacinta Allan in a blue blazer standing next to Rueben Berg on the steps of parliament.

props.synopsis: The Victorian Liberals will scrap the state's proposed Treaty agreement with First Peoples' if elected. The opposition had previously withdrawn support for the proposed agreement, which is set to be debated in Parliament today and is expected to pass with the support of Labor and the Greens.

title.children: Victorian Liberals will scrap Australian-first Treaty within 100 days if elected

image.altText: Nikita Tszyu looks storic

props.synopsis: Nikita Tszyu was involved in a car accident last weekend, putting a possible grudge match fight against Michael Zerafa at risk.

title.children: Tszyu camp suffers mighty scare as Nikita involved in car accident

image.altText: A man with black hair and thick black rimmed glasses speaking at a lectern.

props.synopsis: Andry Rajoelina flees the country amid widespread protests that saw an elite military unit join demonstrators in opposing the government.

title.children: Madagascar's president flees country on French plane

image.altText: A golden egg in a nest symbolising superannuation.

props.synopsis: ASIC's review of 12 super funds collectively responsible for more $1.2 trillion in member assets finds they are failing in customer service and communications, and may not be giving members information to make informed retirement decisions.

title.children: Corporate watchdog slams superannuation funds

image.altText: A portable electronic sign saying "Mt Buffalo National Park Closed" sits beside a road with white blossom trees behind.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police says its search for alleged gunman Dezi Freeman will continue as the Mount Buffalo National Park partially reopens.

title.children: National Park to partially reopen despite Dezi Freeman search

image.altText: A serious Treasurer Jim Chalmers speaks to media during a press conference, lips pressed together, Australian flag behind.

props.synopsis: The treasurer has never been afraid to venture beyond his prime minister with his tax reform ambitions, but on superannuation, he has been pulled into line.

title.children: Chalmers wielded the axe on his super tax, but the PM's fingerprints were obvious

image.altText: Sea foam along the South Australian coast.

props.synopsis: Large scale reef restoration, new real-time water monitoring and a $1 million trial of "AI-powered submersible cytobots" are part of a $102.5 million government algal bloom program to ensure "South Australians can enjoy their summer".

title.children: Reef restoration and submersible cytobots: $100m plan to address algal bloom

image.altText: Signage for Santos is displayed outside the company's visitor information center in Narrabri

props.synopsis: It was a primary force behind Australia’s inflationary surge, it’s forced businesses either to the wall or to shift offshore, undermined national industry policy and resulted in the loss of countless thousands of jobs. And it all hinged on one disastrous decision in an Adelaide boardroom.

title.children: How a boardroom mistake in Adelaide 15 years ago cost you a fortune

image.altText: Man sprays water in his face during heatwave May 2023 India

props.synopsis: Fossil fuel companies and governments have argued it’s not possible to link climate impacts to specific projects, but Australian researchers have done the numbers.

title.children: For the first time, scientists can show the impact of gas project emissions

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair, glasses and a dark suit jacket and top, has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: We get detailed measurements of population, participation and productivity. Advocates want to add a fourth "p" — poverty — so we can understand our economy.

title.children: Poverty is about more than income, but that is all we measure

image.altText: Former AFL coach Nathan Buckley stands holding his mobile phone to his ear at a tennis club.

props.synopsis: Nathan Buckley takes a surprise assistant coaching job as the Collingwood legend awaits on a likely offer to lead Tasmania's inaugural AFL team.

title.children: Nathan Buckley moves back into coaching with surprise club role

image.altText: A woman sitting at a computer in front of a laptop

props.synopsis: Experts on the rules around when you need to inform your employer if you’re planning to take parental leave.

title.children: When to share the news of a pregnancy with your employer
